message.content:
A thimble is a small tool shaped like a bell used to protect fingertips while sewing. 
It is mostly made of metal or plastic, but can also be found in leather or porcelain. 
The top of the thimble is usually rounded or slightly pointed. 
The surface of the tool is often engraved with patterns or designs for aesthetic purposes. 
Thimbles are commonly used in sewing, particularly for hand-sewn projects such as quilting or embroidery. 
They can be found in sewing kits or sold separately in sewing supply stores. 
The purpose of the tool is to prevent the needle from piercing the finger during the sewing process.
